Name: Halo SDK
Description: Software Development Kit (SDK) to access the SOLiD Halo RESTful API.

Errors.ErrorMessage: Invalid or missing parameter is detected.

Parameters.Name: id
Parameters.Description: The new alarm attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Parameters.Name: function
Parameters.Description: The administrative function to be executed

Parameters.Name: setting
Parameters.Description: The new setting attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Endpoints.Name: Store User in Group
Endpoints.Description: Add a member to a group

Endpoints.Name: Remove User from Group
Endpoints.Description: Remove a member from a group

Endpoints.Name: Add Policy to Group
Endpoints.Description: Create and add a policy to a group.

Endpoints.Name: Remove Policy from Group
Endpoints.Description: Delete policy from group with id

Parameters.Name: group
Parameters.Description: The new group attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Parameters.Name: property
Parameters.Description: The new property attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Endpoints.Name: Add Sector Node
Endpoints.Description: Create and add a node to a sector

Endpoints.Name: Remove Sector Node
Endpoints.Description: Delete node from sector with index

Endpoints.Name: Add Sector SNMP
Endpoints.Description: Upload a zip file containing the MIB file and the MIB mapper

Parameters.Name: sector
Parameters.Description: The new sector attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Parameters.Name: user
Parameters.Description: The new user attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Parameters.Name: node
Parameters.Description: The new node attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Parameters.Name: notification
Parameters.Description: The new notification attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Parameters.Name: policy
Parameters.Description: The new policy attribute values. This does not need to be a complete representation. Only attributes to be modified need to be specified. Omitted attributes will retain their current values.

Fields.Name: POST
Fields.Description: The POST method requests that the server accept the entity enclosed in the request as a new subordinate of the web resource identified by the URI. The data POSTed might be, for example, an annotation for existing resources; a message for a bulletin board, newsgroup, mailing list, or comment thread; a block of data that is the result of submitting a web form to a data-handling process; or an item to add to a database.

Fields.Name: PUT
Fields.Description: The PUT method requests that the enclosed entity be stored under the supplied URI. If the URI refers to an already existing resource, it is modified; if the URI does not point to an existing resource, then the server can create the resource with that URI.

Fields.Name: GET
Fields.Description: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data and should have no other effect.

Fields.Name: DELETE
Fields.Description: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

CustomTypes.Name: Alarm Statistic
CustomTypes.Description: Mathematical functions applied to an Alarm to determine how the values are evaluated.

Fields.Name: AVG
Fields.Description: Average refers to the sum of numbers divided by n.

Fields.Name: MAX
Fields.Description: The greatest quantity or amount assigned.

Fields.Name: MIN
Fields.Description: The lowest quantity or amount assigned.

Fields.Name: SUM
Fields.Description: The aggregate of two or more numbers, magnitudes, quantities, or particulars as determined by or as if by the mathematical process of addition.

Fields.Name: id
Fields.Description: The unique system assigned identification of the alarm .

Fields.Name: name
Fields.Description: A convenient identifying name. This is a human assignable value for convenience and is not unique.

Fields.Name: cause
Fields.Description: A description of the conditions that would cause this alarm definition to become active.

Fields.Name: impact
Fields.Description: A description of the impacts that would result in this alarm definition becoming active.

Fields.Name: remedy
Fields.Description: A description of the remedy that would resolve this alarm definition if it becomes active.

Fields.Name: active
Fields.Description: Specifies whether the alarm definition should be actively considered by the system. If this value is `false` the definition is stored but never evaluated.

Fields.Name: period
Fields.Description: A time period (defined in snapshots) that constitutes a single experimental period for this alarm definition.

Fields.Name: periods
Fields.Description: The number of times the experimental time period should be repeated to define this alarm.

Fields.Name: function
Fields.Description: The javascript function that evaluates whether this alarm definition becomes active.

Fields.Name: tags
Fields.Description: Identifying tags. Predominantly used for search functions.

Fields.Name: createdAt
Fields.Description: A system created time stamp recording when this alarm definition was created.

Fields.Name: updatedAt
Fields.Description: A system created time stamp recording when this alarm definition was last modified.

Fields.Name: statistic
Fields.Description: The mathematical function used to pass the values of a single period.

CustomTypes.Name: User State
CustomTypes.Description: The account state of a user

CustomTypes.Name: SNMP Security User
CustomTypes.Description: Representation of an SNMP security user

CustomTypes.Name: SNMP Trap Session
CustomTypes.Description: Representation of an SNMP trap session
